User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Re-Source application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

isBlocked.description: Indicates if the user is blocked from using the application.

isAdmin.description: Indicates if the user has administrative privileges.

id.description: Unique identifier for the listing entity.

userId.description: Reference to the User who created the listing. (Relationship: User 1:N Listing)

description.description: Detailed description of the resource being listed.

category.description: Category of the resource (e.g., textbook, notes).

semester.description: Semester for which the resource is relevant.

imageUrl.description: URL of the image associated with the listing.

isApproved.description: Indicates if the listing is approved by an administrator.

ChatMessage.title: ChatMessage
ChatMessage.description: Represents a message within a conversation.

id.description: Unique identifier for the chat message.

senderId.description: The UID of the user who sent the message.

timestamp.description: The server timestamp when the message was created.

Conversation.title: Conversation
Conversation.description: Represents a chat conversation between two or more users.

participants.description: An array of user UIDs who are part of the conversation.

lastMessage.description: The text of the last message sent in the conversation.

lastMessageTimestamp.description: The server timestamp of the last message.

Wishlist.title: Wishlist
Wishlist.description: Represents a user's wishlist, containing references to saved listings.

userId.description: Reference to the User who owns the wishlist. (Relationship: User 1:N Wishlist)

listingIds.description: References to Listings saved in the wishlist. (Relationship: Listing N:N Wishlist)

Report.title: Report
Report.description: Represents a user-submitted report against a listing for moderation.

listingId.description: Reference to the Listing that is being reported.

reporterId.description: Reference to the User who submitted the report.

reason.description: The reason provided by the user for the report.

summary.description: An AI-generated summary of the report for quick admin review.

status.description: The current status of the report (e.g., 'pending', 'resolved').

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed for a secure and scalable chat and marketplace application. It uses separate top-level collections for major data types. The 'conversations' collection manages chat metadata, with a subcollection for 'messages' to ensure queries remain efficient. This structure allows for secure, rule-based access where users can only access conversations they are participants in. Path-based ownership is used for wishlists to simplify security rules. Denormalization of `userId` in listings ensures ownership can be checked without extra database reads.
